cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category as it deals with speech act recognition on Twitter, which is a natural language processing task. It also proposes a set of semantic and syntactic features for the classification task. 

The paper could also belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category as it deals with communication on social media platforms such as Twitter. 

The sub-category of Software Engineering (cs.SE) could also be a possibility as the paper proposes a method for speech act recognition on Twitter, which could be considered a software engineering task. 

The sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) could also be relevant as the paper deals with classifying tweets based on their content, which is a common task in information retrieval. 

Finally, the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) could also be relevant as the paper uses a logistic regression classifier to classify tweets based on their speech acts.
